channel.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
channel.description:
Hey. I've been working with 3ds max for a while, but never really posted any of my work, so here's some.
I'm posting this for criticism, i need to know what to improve on.
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/GlassFront-2.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/GlassPerspective-2.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/GlassTop-1.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/DeskandGlass-1.jpg[/img]
Thanks, give me your opinions.
I think the glass is perfect. But that's my opinion, quite proud of what i've done though. :)

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:11, topic:280839”][quote author=bowserjr2 link=topic=370901.msg2803995#msg2803995 date=1243616224]
On the 4. picture it look like the desk is floating, not standing on the floor.
[/quote]

It’s not exactly floating, but here’s another angle, it has feet which are unseen in the picture given above, that’s why it gave you that impression.

[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/DeskandGlassFeetView.jpg[img]

(:[/quote]
Still don’t feels like it is on the floor, and why is there not any shadow on the floor?
And it is a carpet rigth?, then you should make it react with the desk like it was a carpet.

And there is to much shadow on one of the sides, rest of it great work :).

Read full topic

@SilentCJ wrote:

On the 4. picture it look like the desk is floating, not standing on the floor.

It’s not exactly floating, but here’s another angle, it has feet which are unseen in the picture given above, that’s why it gave you that impression.

(:

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

In that case it does look like the reference image, I’ve just never seen one like that.

And the distortion looks fine. If it’s set at 1.6/1.56 it’s fine. Different shapes of glass will distort very differently.

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Looking at the desk through the first glass, it looks very distored. OK images get distored in just about any glass, but thats over distorted…

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:5, topic:280839”]You have a severe proportion/scale disorder O_o

The drawer handles are about the same radius as a glass?

And the first glass looks like a glass goblet or something. Did you look at references or anything?[/quote]

Lol.
Never actually noticed that, i’ll fix at some point.

I used reference image:
http://www.interactiontech.com/IITWeb/Uploads/Images/Beer-glass.jpg[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 29-05-2009, 05:56:00[/size][hr]All feedback has been taken in, and i have now changed a few aspects, give me feedback on the wood floor, i’m not good with UVing it to be realistic.

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

You have a severe proportion/scale disorder O_o

The drawer handles are about the same radius as a glass?

And the first glass looks like a glass goblet or something. Did you look at references or anything?

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Ok, thanks for criticism, i’ve fixed a few issues, one of the main ones being i forgot to use smoothing groups on the glass. (:
Changed the wood floor too, i’m not sure if that one is alright?
Feedback.

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

that first wood texture is horrible, but the second is a bit better, the glass is a little cloudy but that seems sorted in the second and third. Overall the textures need work but the modelling is a nice start with 3DS

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Look great, but you should use a better texture on the board and the floor.
And the glass most be fixed a little, but that did you see self so good luck fixing it and make great things in the future.

Read full topic
